intro: Bilabrella cornutella, commonly known as the horned bilabrella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and small, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
